remarks.format: ## Remarks The item and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> parameters initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> properties with their respective values. The `originalArgs` parameter allows you to pass in a set of command arguments, which is useful for handling bubbled events.

Docs.summary: Returns the control that raised the event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The control that raised the event.
Docs.returns: The control that raised the event.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default command. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> attempts to render a shortcut to invoke the default command. In HTML, the default rendering in `ListView` displays the first field as a link to the `DetailsView` of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>. By setting the DefaultCommand property, clicking the link invokes the default command. Invoking the default command raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ItemCommand> event. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs> object is set to the value of the DefaultCommand property.
Even if a default command is defined, you should include a command with the same name in the commands collection. If the control cannot render a graphical element that includes a shortcut for the default command, the default command is still available through the rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection>.

Docs.summary: Returns the list item that generated the event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The list item that generated the event.
